#Text=Tenom
#Text=Tenom is a small town in the interior region of Sabah state in the Malaysia n part of Borneo .
#Text=The quiet and relaxed town is located in a valley and is in the heart of the area inhabited by the Murut people of Sabah .
#Text=There is n't that much to do in Tenom but you may find yourself here to catch the train to Beaufort , which runs along the Padas River .
#Text=By road
#Text=Tenom is more or less the southern end of the main road from Kota Kinabalu into the interior .
#Text=From KK , the road starts from the suburbs of Donggongon and climbs up the Crocker Mountain Range and down to the Tambunan Valley .
#Text=The road continues in a southwest direction to Keningau , Melalap and Tenom .
#Text=There is also a road between Tambunan and Ranau , allowing you to come directly from Mount Kinabalu and Sandakan without needing to go through KK .
#Text=The road hugs the mountains and is frequently closed because of landslides .
#Text=Tenom is 176km from Kota Kinabalu , 163 km from Ranau and 397 km from Sandakan .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Tenom is served mainly by minibuses and minivans and you will most likely have to change at Keningau if you are coming from Kota Kinabalu or Ranau .
#Text=At Kota Kinabalu , minibuses leave from the station opposite Wawasan Plaza at the southern end of town .
#Text=Most minibuses and vans leave in the morning .
#Text=By train
#Text=Tenom is the southern terminus of the Sabah State Railway 's 134km network .
#Text=About four trains or railcars run daily between Tenom ( Station tel : +60-87 -735514 ) and Beaufort , snaking downhill beside the fast-moving Padas River .
#Text=The journey is interesting but slow , taking about two hours .
#Text=One-way economy fare between Tenom and Beaufort is RM2.75 .
#Text=You will have to change trains at Beaufort to continue to Kota Kinabalu .
#Text=Do
#Text=Tenom Agricultural Park ( Malay : Taman Pertanian Sabah ) is part of the 1,500 acres of the Agriculture Research Station which is administered and owned by the Agriculture Department in Sabah .
#Text=It is a complex consisting of the Agriculture Research Station , Seed Production Centre for Cash Crop , Farmers Training Centre and Taman Pertanian Sabah itself .
#Text=The Park sprawls over an area of 500 acres .
#Text=The park was first opened to visitors in October 2000 .
#Text=With its rich biodiversity , the Park has a magnificent collection of indigenous and introduced plants species .
#Text=It is also a conservation centre for the native Orchids of Borneo .

#Text=This park will be the next generation 's heritage and will help to educate people in nature conservation and the preservation of natural rainforest through cultivation of trees , shrubs , plants and flowers .

#Text=The lush greenery , multitude of species of plants/flowers endemic to Borneo Island and very rare , panoramic view of the lakes and captivating landscaped gardens provide an excellent base to expand your knowledge and ideal environment for those who seek peace , quiet and tranquility away from stress and urban noise .
#Text=This park also provides a great trekking ground as well as nature walks and jungle activities .
#Text=The park is a showcase of integrated activities carried out by all the Departments and Agencies under the Ministry of Agriculture Development and Food Industry .
#Text=It also serves as a training and education centre for agriculture , horticulture , apiculture , seed production , forestry , fishery and animal husbandry .
#Text=Entrance fee : Rm25 per person ( children Rm10 , under-13s free )
#Text=Bike rental : Rm3 per hour
#Text=Boat rental : Rm5 per hour
#Text=Chalet/dorm room/camping : Rm150/25/10
#Text=Discounts on all feees of up to 72 % are given to Malaysian visitors .
#Text=Taxi
#Text=from Tenom town centre : Rm30
#Text=Sleep
#Text=There are several places to stay in Tenom .
#Text=Prices range from RM10 to RM400 .
#Text=Perkasa Hotel .
#Text=RM120
#Text=Standard room
#Text=Agriculture Research Station Tenom .

#Text=Tenom Farmstay Holiday .
#Text=Visitors can stay in the homes of local farmers , allowing them a unique opportunity to experience an entirely different way of life .
